snippet: The husband of a Tibetan woman who died after setting herself alight was detained by the police after he refused to blame domestic problems for her act, an overseas group said.
abstract: Chinese police arrest Dolma Kyab, husband of Tibetan protester Kunchoek Wangmo, who died after setting herself on fire, for refusing to blame her act on domestic problems; separate fatal self-immolation is carried out at monastery, and two acts raise number of self-immolations by Tibetans within China to 109 since 2009.
lead_paragraph: The husband of a Tibetan woman who died after setting herself alight was detained by the police after he refused to blame domestic problems for her act, an overseas group said.

headline.seo: China Arrests Man After Wife’s Self-Immolation Protest
headline.main: China Arrests Man After Wife’s Self-Immolation Protest
